TopicTitle: Which spacecraft would you stay in for a 20 day mission: voskhod or the soyuz 7k-ok?

Articles.Content:
Setting: you are a cosmonaut in the second half of the 60's, your present mission is a grand state propoganda and scientific mission to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the revolution. In the mission you and another crew member (2 crew) must survive in space for 20 days, doing experiments, broadcasting on state tv, a live tv EVA, oh and to catch up with those pesky americans you will be flying through various layers of the van allen belts. OKB-1 have decided to let you pick your ship out of two, the Voskhod and the Soyuz 7K-OK, these ships are considered the most dangerous to have ever flown, so pick your poison, here is some facts:

Voskhod:

Comfort-small, slightly cramped but better then Gemini, oh and the walls are padded with soft orange fabric .

Safety-lacks LES, IVA suits provided for you and your buddy in case of cabin depress, large solid fuelled deorbit emergency motor. Can have have random system failures, includes oxygen percentage increases, guidance computer failure, main deorbit engine failure, service module seperation fail. No room to exercise (may lose bones...).

EVA-you will be using berkut space suits designed for voskhod, remember Alexis spacewalk...

Van allen belts-considering the voskhod capsule is a thick vostok reinforced with more "armour" and a vacuum layer, you should be fine.

7K-OK:

Comfort-very large, plenty of room to move around in, has a toilet and a wooden desk to do stuff.

Safety-has a LES, no suits in case of cabin dep, two sets of deorbit engines. LOTS OF RANDOM SYSTEM FAILURES, literally anything that can go wrong could and probably would. Exercise room.

EVA-you will have the yastreb suit, a grand improvement over the berkut removing problems such as ballooning, over heating, catching the bends and a chance of death. The main problem is a it tends to be stiff and rigid, you will be fine as long as you don't let go of the handrail.

Van allen belts-just that thin wall between you and it...

Personally I would take my chances on the Voskhod.
While the padded walls of the Voskhod are tempting, I would have to go with the 7K, as I believe it has more cargo straps to keep me tied to the walls after day 10.
Soyuz has a space toilet so my vote would be soyuz. You'd be surprised what that little convenience does for your psychological well being.
Voskhod's life support was only rated for ten man-days. I'll pick danger of failure over certain suffocation any time.

Voskhod 3 and 4 were supposed to be a 19 and 20-day missions, but they were cancelled.
